message.content:
cs.IT, cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.EM, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper discusses the use of human body communication (HBC) as a communication medium for wearable health monitoring devices. Information theory plays a crucial role in analyzing the signal transfer characteristics of the implemented HBC-based system. 
2. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The paper focuses on the design and implementation of a wearable health monitoring system that involves human-machine interaction through HBC. The system is designed to be user-friendly and easy to use for health monitoring purposes. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the use of wireless body area networks (WBAN) and HBC for connecting wearable health monitoring devices. The networking aspect of the system is crucial for transmitting and analyzing health data. 
4. cs.EM (Electromagnetics): The paper discusses the use of capacitive voltage mode HBC for transmitting health data between wearable devices. Electromagnetic theory plays a crucial role in analyzing the signal transfer characteristics of the implemented HBC-based system. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses the system design constraints and signal transfer characteristics for the implemented HBC-based wearable health monitoring system. Control theory plays a crucial role in designing and optimizing the system for reliable connectivity and power savings.
